From Vision to Value Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(6) Digital Transformation Vision

Our Digital Transformation Initiative will turn us into the leader of the industry by allowing us to interact with our customers more easily, and more frequently. By increasing the number of customer touchpoints and using the resulting feedback to quickly and relentlessly adapt and improve our offerings, we will be able to outperform our competition and turn into the market leader within the next three years.


From Vision to Value Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(7) Digital Transformation: The Default Choice



From Vision to Value Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:

(8) The Execution Gap



From Vision to Value Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(9) From Vision to Value

  • Set a vision as the goal to improve the organization
  • Define a strategy how to turn the vision into reality
  • Create a program to turn the strategy into reality
  • Build a platform as the new foundation for creating value

Digital Transformation Determinants Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(11) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]
  • Adapting strategy: Adapt to expectations, technology, and competition
  • Adapting structure: Changeability is more important than optimization
  • Technology opportunities: Openness for creating and delivering value in new ways


Digital Transformation Determinants Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(12) The Three Pillars: Business, Organization, Technology



Digital Transformation Determinants Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(13) All Pillars are Necessary but not Sufficient

  • Business makes sure building blocks are assembled with a purpose
  • Organization makes sure building/changing products can be done quickly
  • Technology provides good building blocks and scalable ways to use them

(16) API Products: Digital Building Blocks



Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(17) Why? The Network Effects Needs a Network

  • It's ineffective to do digital transformation light
  • ROI grows more than linear because options grow more than linear


Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(18) What? The Platform is a Team Effort

  • Everybody consumes and contributes building blocks
  • Nobody assumes that their product cannot be reused or improved


Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(19) How? Collaboration Needs Design and Discipline

  • API products are essential as useful building blocks
  • API product thinking is important for designing building blocks
  • Everybody thinks about building API products for everybody else

Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(21) Start Small

  • Identify low-hanging fruit for quick success and feedback
  • Switch from building systems to cultivating ecosystems
  • Start building a culture and a community


Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(22) Design for Change

  • Ecosystem architecture and system architecture are distinct disciplines
    • APIs allow you to start building a landscape of API products
    • How to build API products is a different and distinct task
  • The role of ecosystem architecture is to support development teams
    • Constrain them as much as necessary but as little as possible
    • Cleanly separate constraints from how to implement them
    • Provide support for following constraints and testing for them


Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(23) Cultivate the Landscape

  • Be clear on your vision and strategy
  • Start with small and focused effort and teams
  • Build up competencies and ways to share them across teams
  • Shift from centralized systems to decentralized ecosystems

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization

(25) The Power of Strategy

  • Growing and evolving your business needs a solid platform
  • APIs work best when the network effect is taking off
  • ROI is best when the platform is reaching critical mass quickly


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): The Network Effect as Strategy:
Product Management for Digitalization
